intro: Cyrtandra sarawakensis var. sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky or mossy substrates. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
